text:
Sup you beautiful bastards 
hope you are having a fantastic Friday
Welcome back to the Philip Defranco Show
And if you are new here on Fridays we do things a little bit different
On Fridays I try to cover more viewer requested stories from the week
And this week in fact because we have now developed time travel technology
Including stories that were cut for time this week
Either because the videos themselves were already too long, or they were going to make us just extremely late
But with that said lets just jump into it
And the first thing we are going to talk about today is the story about
How I have finally accomplished something my son did before me
I have finally become a meme my son was on a roller coaster when he was young and became a meme
I shared a photo of my cousin at a wedding she became a massive meme
And finally after saying it for ten damn years
Let's just jump into has become a MEME
And there is a range let's experience it together

Any character fully charged smash attack 
Me: let's just jump into

Puddle exists
My kids: let's just jump into

On roof with fiend, Me: lets Jump... 
Wow that got, that got........ That got dark fast!
For those of you that put my dumb face in new avenues of the internet thank you

But also now that I have acknowledged it 
I imagine it will die
Just as when I asked people to stop calling me daddy... uh... that definitely stopped everyone
Or maybe I am saying all this so that you think that I want it so then you don't do it

Or is that what I want, its all very confusing 
I don't even know the actual answer anymore
There we go,  like I said it is viewer requested it is for better and worse. Moving on...
And then, of course,  lets talk about updates around this situation that we have been dealing with on YouTube this week
And kind of a TL;DR, and keep in mind that this is just very on the surface level not the deep dive that we did before
if you want to see that I will link down to those video down below
But kind of a TL;DR to bring you to this moment
Earlier this week there was a video that blew up,  were it showed that you know
if you search certain things that you could end up in this worm hole where all of a sudden you are getting
Videos of young children doing gymnastics and if you went to the comment section it was just horrible
Just monstrous comments about the kids people seemingly praying on them
then sharing time codes of them being in vulnerable positions
It was a horrible thing to see but if you have been on YouTube a while you know YouTube is trying to combat this
But seemingly rather than trying to just get the word out that this is happening
Reporting these comments to YouTube which YouTube has been combating
The person who made the video that blew up including a comunity of small people around him
Just started spamming advertisers that may have had their ads put on these videos
That once again most of these videos were fine it was the comments section that horrible
So Brands did what brands do they got extremely panicky
all of a sudden people were pulling their ad campaigns, pausing them
and while all of this was happening YouTube jumped into action
if you didn't see they told us Quote
"in the last 48 hours, beyond our normal protections we've disabled comments on tens of millions of videos."
"We've also terminated over 400 channels for the commends they left on videos, and reported illegal comments to law enforcement"
Right so as we have discussed YouTube takes this very seriously, they have been developing technology
They have been doing mass hiring trying to handle it
But with all of this every time we have talked about this I have explained
that this is a lose lose situation for YouTube no matter what
when certain videos or comment sections slip through and there is this disgusting thing that is out there
All of a sudden people throw out this crazy narrative that youtube is fine with all of this horrible stuff

they are just so happy to monetise it
which is a ridiculous and insane narrative
alright so that is a lose for them there of course with this story YouTube is going to have to crack down
even more than they have been doing which means with youtube scale how massive this site is
how many minutes of video are uploaded every single second
there is really no perfect way for them to crack down without some people that should not be getting hit getting hit
and that is the big update that we saw last night
Jessica Ballinger who is a family YouTuber on this platform posted that all of a sudden she had several of her videos demonetised

Saying "my 5 year old son does gymnastics and is a happy, sweet, confident  boy,
Youtube: Not advertiser friendly
And that post was growing on its own but was definitely super charged
thanks to Colleen Ballinger who is of course Miranda Sings and her sister-in-law
Quote tweeting it saying  "this is ridiculous!!"
Team YouTube then responded to jessica tweeting "Hi there--for reference, over the past few days,
we've taken a number of actions to better protect the YouTube community from content that endangers minors.
Then because why not throw me into this, they wrote "Here is a tweet from PhillyD for more context
So essentially youtubes first response was they tweeted a TL;DR tweet that linked to my TL;DR tweet
That included a screen shot that had an official but maybe not official comment from team YouTube
Which if I can chime in real quick its probably better for you guys to have an offical blog post
rather than linking to my tweet but we'll continue
and the second of the tweets they sent to Jessica is one that just sent the YouTube community into a frenzy
They wrote "With regard to the actions that we have taken, even if your video is suitable for advertisers,
inappropriate comments could result in your video receiving limited or no ads (yellow icon)
let us know if you have any questions
and in general the entire YouTube community was like "Yeah we got Questions!! WHAT??"
But even to the tweet they linked of mine I mean there is no reference of demonetisation there
so all of a sudden you have all of the creators saying "wait so so essentially people could bombard my YouTube comment section and i'm gonna get demonetised?"
that's insane you could weaponize that policy to attack any one, and this fear spread incredibly fast
for example there was a really viral tweet from Colleen again
Writing "so now YouTube can punish creators by disabling the comment section & demonetising videos if the comments aren't ad friendly?
If this is true, every YouTuber needs to start looking for a new job. There are hardly any videos on YouTube that lack vile comments. How is this fair?
And you know because I like many others was nervous I reached out to my contacts over at YouTube
And while I don't have an official comment yet because I think they are working for an official blog post so that they can have like this one place that they can point to
What it sounds like, and I think that is a safe way to say it that this is not a policy that will affect all YouTubers
Instead; 1. it seems hyper specific to the content that this could happen on
For example when you look to the photo that Jessica posted where you have several videos that have been demonetized
Several of them have something in common, and that is that they have a young young child doing a split
Fully in frame in the thumbnail, and that ends up being very close to the kind of content that we talked about earlier this week
That YouTube was coming under fire for
completely clean nothing inappropriate video that ended up featuring a child doing something like gymnastics
So it appears that right now that if the focus of the video is a very very young child
And they are doing something that  could be manipulated or prayed upon or you get the idea that would be a video that could be affected
But also what it sounded like is that YouTube right now may be over correcting because they are getting so hammered by the media and advertisers.
It very much sounded like the preferred method to control things moving forward
Would not be to demonetize videos but rather just shut down the comment section
Which I think for creators like Jessica will be frustrating but obviously that would be way better than just getting mass demonetized
And actually literally as we were exporting today's show YouTube did update this story
I'm going to link to it down below but you can see more information there
But yeah that is the situation as it is now. I am going to keep my eyes open to see if we get a new comment or get any updates from youtube
But really it was only a matter of time with this story till something like this happened
The kind of situation where YouTube is both classified as a place where YouTube does't even care if you post horrible things
where children are vulnerable and also at the same time Anti-creator for cracking down
But that is the situation as it is right now and of course with this I pass the question off to you
Because I am very interested in to know what your thoughts are
There are a lot of different creators and a lot of different communities that are receiving
all of this new information and some of  the updates a lot differently
so I am really just interested to hear from you
Then for our next story we are going to have to jump through time,
haters are gonna say that it is just jump cuts but it is time travel don't @ me *claps to the past time*
And then lets talk about sports but its not really a sports story but it involves sports let me explain
So if you don't watch college basket ball you might not be aware that Duke university played the university of North Carolina last night
And this is a massive game you have tonnes of people across the nation tuning in to the game
You have people in attendance like Barack Obama,  Spike lee
But the story is not about them it is about Duke freshman Zion Williamson
He is a massive basket ball star and NBA hopeful and understand when I say NBA hopeful they are expecting him to get drafted Number 1
But he ended up having to leave the game with a crazy injury that happened within a minute of the opening tip off
He falls and he grabs his knee, and if you watch the clip which I don't think we can actually show you
He slips but he also actually doesn't slip, what happened is his shoe just fell apart, the sole literally broke off from the shoe
And after this happens he ends up walking off the court to try a new shoe but he eventually leave for the locker room
And in fact later that night Duke announce that he had sustained a mild sprained knee
And in this game North Carolina the number 8 team would go on to beat Duke who was the number 1 team in the country
But that is not really the story here.Since last night people all over social media have been talking about that blown out shoe
Which was actually made by Nike. And Nike of course is a huge brand that sponsors tonnes of sports teams of different levels
And infact they provide Duke with their uniforms as part of a 12 year contract that they have with the  school that ends in 2027
And so we have seen a tonne of  backlash against Nike many people trashing the brand online
Saying, they could have ruined Zion's career.
And infact looking in to it further there are sneaker heads out there that are saying he shouldn't have been wearing this shoe in the first place.
This because he is wearing the PG 2.5, which is part of Nike's collaboration with the Oklahoma city thunder player Paul George
PG 2.5 retails for $110 and is currently on sale on Nike's official site for $92.97
And so you had a lot of people wondering what a 6ft 7in (200cm), 285lb (129kg) playing basket ball at the highest level
Was wearing one of Nike's cheaper basket ball shoes instead of one with features better suited for his position
And Brad Crawford even penned a piece for 24/7 sports diving even deeper into these shoes.
He mentioned the PG 2.5s were engineered for guards
And even said that this model was actually one of the least expensive options
out of many of the other options that Zion could have chosen to wear
And added from "In-game photos. williamson's pair of the player edition PG 2.5 in Duke's familiar white and blue colorway
Appeared to be worn quite a bit hence more give than usual in the mid sole where separation occurred in a violent manner
He goes on to say that if you wear a shoe enough pressure points will of course weaken all areas
And in general he is saying that the shoe falling apart wasn't actually surprising
Now as far as Nike's response to all of this they have since released a statement saying
"we are obviously concerned and want to wish Zion a speedy recovery."
"The quality and performance of out products are of utmost importance"
While this is an isolated occurrence, we are working to identify the issue"
And the thing is looking at that statement,
that statement makes sense that investigation if they actually do it makes sense
Not because maybe they as a company care about Zion that is a question about intention
But this is horrible press for Nike and it is also seemingly affecting their business
Since last night the company stock which had been doing really really well it was riding this nice wave has dropped over a percent
Which maybe you hear that and are like well one percent is nothing, but when you are talking about a company that has the market value of Nike that's a lot of money.
I mean think about it this way I am simplifying and minimising the situation a little bit but it is still true
A guy slipped and hurt himself because his shoe was busted and company lost over a billion dollars in market value
Now keep in mind the stock market and value in general its all fluid this is in my opinion most likely going to be a blip for Nike
But in the mean time especially based off the actions or inaction  of people involved with that company I mean that's a massive deal.
Also of note with this story has been this conversation of should Zion return
Whilst tonnes of people are wishing Zion a healthy recovery including Barack Obama on twitter
There has also been a lot of talk about whether he should even return to play college ball
You know we have talked about NCAA in the past and while it wasn't a big topic of our  last video
When you have people that play in college they are not getting paid
Meanwhile there is the ever present threat that at any time he could be injured and lose his entire career
In this situation Zion was wearing a brand that he had to wear but if he wants to get to the NBA
And he does't want to play overseas he has to play in college because they don't draft highschool players anymore
Which actually on that note intrestingly enough, part of this story has to do with insurance. Zion actually has a loss of value insurance policy.
Which if you have never heard of that according to the NCAA
It "protects student-athlete's future contract value from decreasing below a predetermined amount due to a significant injury or illness suffered during the policy's designated coverage period
And according to reports Williamson's policy is actually worth $8 million on the chance that he is picked 16th or later in the NBA draft.
And personally finding that out if I was Zion I would have flopped harder than Neymar
I would have been grabbing every part of my body, I would show up in the second half in a full body cast
Maybe you get drafted late by an even better team than you expected
Especially because once again while the school and coaches and everyone except the actual players are getting paid
It is the players that are at risk every single da y
But with all of that said the big reaction, the stock market, the future
At the end of the day unless there is another injury most likely Zion will still be picked before the 16th spot
Also a thing to consider is that reportedly this is just a mild sprain so this is not a long standing injury
It is more of a scare. As far as the possibility of Williamson sitting out from here that seems unlikely
Unless he is drastically changed because of this incident
In a recent weeks leading up to this incident he said he would have played a year in college even  if the rule didn't exist
Adding "if i was going to sit out I would't have gone to college I am thankful that Coach K gave me the opportunity"
And so for now it seems like the main person or group here damaged from this incident is Nike
Who,  I mean they have been criticised for the quality of their gear in the past
I mean back in 2017 there were complaints because NBA jerseys were ripping. But yeah there was that
And with that said we go back to the Future *clap to the future*
Reversed Time travel noises *glitch in the matrix*
From that I want to share some stuff I love today in Today In Awesome. Brought to you by Aaptive.com/Phil
I don't know about you guys but over the last four months I have just let my self go
I don't feel good I am barely active alot I have just be really stressed out and not handling it in the best of ways
But since it helped me out so much last time I'm jumping back on the Aaptive train
Because I am me well two birds one stone lets reach out lets get a sponsorship with them as well
And they were just on board they Upped it if you go to Aaptive.com/Phil you sign up that way you actually get 50% off
And if you are not familiar with Aaptive they have audio based fitness workouts
It make the activity more interesting gives you that drive to got further for lets say running, outdoor or treadmill
Hell even Elliptical which is the most boring activity int the world
Indoor cycling, Yoga, Strength training. They have got fantastic trainers and a fantastic community  and a fantastic app
A|nd if you want you can get started today along with me at Aaptive.com/phil
And the first bit of awesome today is a reminder if you didn't watch yesterday's extra morning news deep dive
I highly recomend it, its a peice that myself and the team are very very proud of
Even better than the positive reaction to the video has been the reaction of the video
Has been watching the comments on this story that I think a lot of people didn't even know about before
Because a lot of people live this and there is also a lot more to it and if we talk about, like if we fully deep dived into this thing we could have made a 60 minute video
But yeah definitely check that out
Then we had offset going undercover on Reddit YouTube and  twitter
We had Zefrank the Grandfather of internet video giving us true facts on the lemur
We got a video on a Question you ask your self ever day, Why it is almost impossible to spin 300 hula hoops at once
We got a trailer for, The Kid, Afterlife, Barry season 2,
Which by the way if you haven't  seen season one its great, it really picks up it's got a whole different feel after the first few episodes
And we had the Info graphics show giving us what do celebrities spend millions on
Then it finally actually happened  you had Elon Musk and Justin Roiland on Meme Review
And if you want to see the full versions of everything I just shared the secret link of the day really anything at all. Links, as always,  are in the description down bellow
And then lets talk about ISIS! And if you listen really closely you can hear the demonetisation right from here
So and this is a really interesting one
There are two young women who joined ISIS in Syria when they were teenagers and they are now begging to go back home to their home countries
One is from Alabama here in the states and the other is from London. And these to cases are actually very similar
And we will start with Hoda Muthana who was 19 when she decided in 2014 to leave Alabama to join ISIS in their former capital of Raqqa
She reportedly told her family she was going on a school trip to Atlanta back in November of 2014 and when she got there she then got on a plane to turkey
And as far as how she got to Syria that remains unclear at this moment
But when got there she first married and Australian jihadist who died fighting for ISIS then she married a tunisian man who she has a 18 month old child with
That second husband also died fighting for ISIS and she recently married her 3rd husband a Syrian man but she says she doesn't know where he is right now
And a few weeks ago she fled with her son from Sousa, Which is a village not far from where US backed forces are closing in on ISIS
And after she made her way towards the Kurdish area in northern Syria.
Now this escape apparently wasn't her first attempt and she told the guardian on Monday that she tried to escape for months
I've been planning literally planning
to get out for months. I got caught twice
by Isis and I was so scared
I broke my phone
From what I heard, If they were to
read my messages I would've been killed
And after wandering the desert for two nights she was captured by Kurdish forces
So now she and her son are now in a camp for the displaced and what will ultimately happen to her is still being decided
Also around this story there was an interview with Hoda that aired on Tuesday. And it was kind of interesting
She tries to explain how she went from living in the United states to joining Isis
And in it she says one of the things that led her down the path towards Isis was her extremely strict upbringing
Saying she found that the only way out was to become more religious.
"I had a good relationship with my family but I wanted a more Americanised life
I just wanted to go out I wanted to have like friends go to places I didn't get any of that. The only way out for me was just to become practising.
To become more religious
more religous,  yeah
Then from there she began connecting with pro Isis Muslims online and with this also joining a twitter group of roughly  3000 to spread Isis propaganda
Using here account she tweeted things like,
"veterans, Patriot, Memorial etc Day parades.. go on drive by's and spill all of their blood or rent a big truck and drive all over them, kill them"
And from there when she said she heard that the Caliphate was announced that she felt it was her duty to go#
And in her ABC interview Hoda expressed remorse
Its crazy I can't even believe I thought of that really,
Its um, the more I gain knowledge the more I knew that It wasn't correct
so we had just young people not knowing much about their religion
we interpreted everything very wrong
I hope america doesn't think I am a threat to them and hope that they can accept me
Also now saying she regrets what she did, and that she was brainwashed
And so as far as what is going to happen well on Tuesday
we saw the us state department  spokesperson Robert Palladino saying that he couldn't discuss her particular case
But did say quote "our policy is this regard would be to repatriate them, and what it's what we call on all countries to do who have FTF (Forigen terrorist) fighters in Syria"
"Repatriating these foreigen terorrist fighters to their countries of origin, ensuring that they are prosecuted and detained"
"that's the best solution to preventing them from returning to the battlefield. We view these fighters as global threat and we seek global cooperation to resolve that threat."
We have also seen trump in the past say that he wants American Isis fighters brought back to the US to face justice
But on Wednesday secretary of state Mike Pompeo said in a statement that Hoda is not a US citizen and thus will not be allowed  to return to the United states
Saying "she does not have any legal basis, no valid U.S. passport, no right to a passport, nor any visa to travel to the United States
We also saw Donald Trump tweet " I have instructed Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, and he fully agrees, not to allow Hoda Muthana back into the country"
And at this point you might be a little bit confused, right so she was from Alabama she left but she is not a US citizen
Well according to Muthana's family attorney Pompeo's assertion that Hoda is not a citizen is based on the fact that Hoda is a daughter of a former Yemeni diplomat
Which is important because children born in america to foreign diplomats are not automatically considered US citizens
But Muthana's attorney says that the Trump administrations Position is based on a complicated interpretation of that law
Stating "They're claming her dad was a diplomat when she was born, which infact, he wasn't"
Also adding " The Trump administration continues its attempts to wrongfully strip citizens of their citizenship"
And "Hoda Muthana had a valid US passport and is a citizen. She was born in Hakensack, NJ in October 1994 months after her father stopped being a diplomat"
So there is that situation and then we have the Brit. So as I mentioned earlier it is a pretty similar case
We have Shamima Begum who was 15 when she left London to join Isis back in 2015.
She also married an Isis fighter and she had two children that died
Shamima actually gave birth to their third child over the weekend in the same camp that Hoda is being held
She also did an interview although she did it with the BBC.
And in it she was asked about what she thinks about here role as part of the terror organisation and given the chance to apologise for it
And what is really interesting she appears to be almost unapologetic
So here is your opportunity to apologise to some of the people who were murdered by the group that you  joined
Some of the British men, some of the women some of the kids from Manchester who were killed in the Manchester arena
You must have heard about that attack
What did you think about that
I was shocked but  *baby cries off screen *

I just couldn't
I didn't know about the kids actually, but....
I still haven't heard you apologies to anybody
Okay yeah, I am sorry to all of the families that have lost them, like husbands and sons and brothers
you know
And I'm sorry for all the men that have lost their women and children because of the attacks back in the Uk and other countries
It wasn't fair on them, they weren't fighting anyone, they weren't

They weren't causing any harm
and neither wasn't, neither was I
And neither are the women who are being killed right now back in Baghuz
She then goes on to call atrocities caused by Isis a "two way thing"
It's a two way thing really
Because women and children are being killed back in the Islamic state right now
And it is kind of retaliation, like their justification was retaliation so I though okay so that is
A fair justification
Also In another interview with sky news she said "I don't regret it because it's changed me as a person"
"It's made me stronger, tougher. I married my husband I wouldn't have found someone like him back in the UK."
"I had my kids" and adding "I did have a good time there, it's just that at the end things got harder and I couldn't take it anymore."
And now Sharmima says she wants to return to the UK for the sake of her child
However British authorities have indicated that they may revoke her citizenship
In fact on Wednesday during an interview Shamima was shown a letter from the british government that she has infact lost her UK citizenship
Please find enclosed papers that relate to a decision taken by the home secretary
To deprive your daughter Shaminma Begum of her British citizenship
What do you think?
I don't know what to say
I am not that shocked but I am a bit shocked
And this move raised questions about what would happen to her child
To which Britain's interior minister said "Children should not suffer. So if a parent does lose their British citizenship, It does not affect the rights of their child."
You also had likes of UK conservative MP George Freeman saying that revoking her citizenship was a mistake
Writing on twitter "I'm afraid that for various reasons I think today's decision to strip Miss Begum of her UK citizenship is a mistake & a dangerous precedent."
"She was born here, educated here & is our responsibility. We should defend our system & she should be brought back to face the UK courts."
Also on this note according to International and UK law it is illegal to revoke someones citizenship if that would leave that person stateless
So how has her citizen ship been revoked?
Well according to section 42 of the British Nationality Act of 1981, Which I am so familiar with
The secretary of state can deprive a person of a citizenship status if the secretary of state is satisfied that deprivation is conducive to the public good
As long as they would not become stateless as a result
And because both of Shamima's parents are Bangladeshi nationals according to Bangladeshi law that would make her a citizen
However Shamima was born in the Uk and claims to not be a dual citizen
Saying in an interview "I wasn't born in Bangladesh, I've  never seen Bangladesh"
"and I don't even speak Bengali properly, so how can they claim I have Bangladeshi Citizenship"
But because she could technically apply for Bangladeshi passport that is thought to be the justification behind the move to revoke her citizenship
Which on that note Wednesday morning a Bangladeshi state minister of foreign affairs said in a statement
"The government of Bangladesh is deeply concerned that Begum has been erroneously identified as a holder of dual citizenship"
So as of right now it is unclear if the move to revoke her citizen ship will actually stand up to a challenge
But Shamima has also said that she may attempt to gain dutch citizenship through her husband
And so ultimately that you now understand those two situations, as far as my personal opinion
I do believe that there is an option that all these countries have not considered
That we just take these Isis or former Isis fighters and we throw them into the ocean (sarcasm)
He said sarcastically as to not create some sort of controversy about violence
But I mean what do you think? Do you think the UK and the United states they should bring them back prosecute them ?

I mean that is what you should be doing here
Or no you think take that trash somewhere else
And really any and all thoughts on this subject I would love to know
And that is where I am going to end today's show
And remember if you like this video you like these daily dives into the news let us know hit that like button
Also if you are new here and want more hit subscribe ring that bell to turn on notifications those somtimes even work
Also if you really want to make sure you get notifications for the videos you should follow me on twitter and turn on notifications there
Also on that note if you missed the last Philip Defranco show and or
The morning news deep dive and you want to catch up you can click or tap right there to watch those
But with that said of course as always my name is Philip Defranco you have just been filled in I love your faces and I will see you Monday
